title: "Supplemental Information: Weather impact on racial composition and citation activity of traffic stops in the United States"
output: pdf_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(fastDummies)
library(stargazer)
library(splines)
library(scales)
library(ggplot2)
load("PolicingRegData.RData")
dfcity1        = subset(dfcity,hispanic==0)
dfstate1       = subset(dfstate,hispanic==0)
dfcity1rain    = subset(dfcity1,tempk>278.15)
dfstate1rain   = subset(dfstate1,tempk>278.15)
glmblack       = dget("FunGLMBlack.R")
glmcitation    = dget("FunGLMCitation.R")
citylist       = c("AR1","AZ2","CA2","CA4","CA5","CA7","CA8","CA9","CO1","CT1","KS1",
                   "KY1","KY2","LA1","MN1","NC1","NC2","NC3","NC4","NC5","NC7","ND1",
                   "NJ1","NV1","NY1","OH1","OH2","OK1","OK2","PA1","TN1","TX1","TX3",
                   "TX6","TX7","VT1","WI1")
statelist      = c("CT2","FL2","GA1","MI1","ND2","NH1","NY2","OH3","TN2","TX8","WI2")
nsdf6          = ns(dfcity1$clocktime,df=6)
colnames(nsdf6)= c("ns1","ns2","ns3","ns4","ns5","ns6")
dfcity1        = cbind(dfcity1,nsdf6)
dfcity1        = dummy_cols(dfcity1,select_columns="jcode")
names(dfcity1) = sub("jcode_","",names(dfcity1))
nsdf6          = ns(dfstate1$clocktime,df=6)
colnames(nsdf6)= c("ns1","ns2","ns3","ns4","ns5","ns6")
dfstate1       = cbind(dfstate1,nsdf6)
dfstate1       = dummy_cols(dfstate1,select_columns="jcode")
names(dfstate1)= sub("jcode_","",names(dfstate1))
nsdf6          = ns(dfcity1rain$clocktime,df=6)
colnames(nsdf6)= c("ns1","ns2","ns3","ns4","ns5","ns6")
dfcity1rain    = cbind(dfcity1rain,nsdf6)
dfcity1rain    = dummy_cols(dfcity1rain,select_columns="jcode")
names(dfcity1rain) = sub("jcode_","",names(dfcity1rain))
nsdf6          = ns(dfstate1rain$clocktime,df=6)
colnames(nsdf6)= c("ns1","ns2","ns3","ns4","ns5","ns6")
dfstate1rain   = cbind(dfstate1rain,nsdf6)
dfstate1rain   = dummy_cols(dfstate1rain,select_columns="jcode")
names(dfstate1rain)= sub("jcode_","",names(dfstate1rain))
```
The following document presents supplemental information. All data and code to recreate the analysis in the paper is available at [https://www.github.com/trafficstops/Paper](https://www.github.com/trafficstops/Paper). Here is the Quick Guide to replicate the results and Supplemental Information. 

1. Download the 9 files in the aforementioned GitHub repository in a folder onto your local drive.
2. Run `PolicingMain.R` to get the paper results. This will also write the `PolicingRegData.RData` into the folder. Make sure all the necessary R packages are available. 
3. Run `PolicingSupplementalInfo.Rmd`.

Here is the slightly longer version. The repository contains the following main files necessary to replicate the analysis and results in the main manuscript:

- `PolicingMain.R`
- `PolicingData.RData`

For the file `PolicingMain.R` to run, the following functions are required as well:

- `FunGLMBlack.R`
- `FunGLMCitation.R`
- `FunOrmsbeeDeterministic.R`
- `FunOrmsbeeStochastic.R`
- `FunProRain.R`

Executing the file `PolicingMain.R` replicates the calculations to obtain Tables 1 and 2 as well as Figure 2. Note that on Line 102 and 106 of `PolicingMain.R`, the software writes and immediately reads the following file:  

- `PolicingRegData.RData`

The file `PolicingRegData.RData` is necessary to compile the Supplemental Information. The code prior to line 102 determines the precipitation distribution over various time intervals (i.e., 10-, 15-, 20-minute intervals). The code after line 106, executes the actual analysis from the paper. The source file and the pdf-file associated this document are included as well.

## City summary statistics on race and citation
Note that for some cities, the data is missing regarding the issuance of citations whereas for others, the summary statistics indicate that for 100\% of stops a citation was issued. For the analysis with $citation$ as the dependent variable, all cities (and states) with a value of 100\% citations were removed. 

```{r citysummary,echo=FALSE,results='asis'}
share               = aggregate(dfcity[,c("black","hispanic","white","citation")],
                                FUN=mean,by=list(dfcity$jcode))
colnames(share)     = c("jcode","black","hispanic","white","citation")
share               = merge(share,juridictions,by=c("jcode"))
share               = share[,c("jurisdiction","state","black","hispanic","white","citation")]
colnames(share)     = c("City","State","Black","Hispanic","White","Citation")
share$Black         = percent(share$Black,2)
share$Hispanic      = percent(share$Hispanic,2)
share$White         = percent(share$White,2)
share$Citation      = percent(share$Citation,2)
opts                = options(knitr.kable.NA = "")
knitr::kable(share,align=rep('r',5))
```

## Robustness checks regarding weather disaggregation
For data main results in the manuscript, we have used the "deterministic" approached presented in [Ormsbee (1989)](https://doi.org/10.1061/(asce)0733-9429(1989)115:4(507)). This section uses the "stochastic" approach including for the 20-minute interval. Our results are robust to a different method in distributing the precipitation data over the interval of one hour. 

### City data and 20-min intervals
```{r,echo=FALSE,message=FALSE,warning=FALSE,output=FALSE,include=FALSE}
bhat1      = glmblack("sto20",dfcity1,"City")
bhat2      = glmblack("sto20+night:sto20",dfcity1,"City")
bhat3      = glmblack("sto20+tempk",dfcity1,"City")
bhat4      = glmblack("sto20+tempk+sto20:tempk",dfcity1,"City")
bhat5      = glmblack("sto20+tempk+sto20:tempk+night:sto20",dfcity1,"City")
```

```{r,echo=FALSE,results='asis'}
stargazer(bhat1,bhat2,bhat3,bhat4,bhat5,type="latex",no.space=TRUE,header=FALSE,
          omit=c(citylist,statelist,"ns1","ns2","ns3","ns4","ns5","ns6","clocktime","dststart"))
```

## Robustness checks regarding rain versus precipitation
The results in the main paper are based on precipitation which includes all forms (e.g., rain, sleet, snow). In this section, we exclude all traffic stops that were conducted below 5 degrees Celsius to ensure that only rain is measured. Again, the results are robust and overlap with results presented in the main text. 

### City data
```{r,echo=FALSE,message=FALSE,warning=FALSE,output=FALSE,include=FALSE}
bhat1     = glmblack("det",dfcity1rain,"City")
bhat2     = glmblack("det+night:det",dfcity1rain,"City")
bhat3     = glmblack("det+tempk",dfcity1rain,"City")
bhat4     = glmblack("det+tempk+det:tempk",dfcity1rain,"City")
bhat5     = glmblack("det+tempk+det:tempk+night:det",dfcity1rain,"City")
```

```{r,echo=FALSE,results='asis'}
          omit=c(citylist,statelist,"ns1","ns2","ns3","ns4","ns5","ns6","clocktime","dststart"))
```

## Traffic Stop Rate and Proportion Black
```{r,echo=FALSE}
load("PolicingRegData.RData")
#--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
stoprate_state      = data.frame(night=numeric(),clocktime=numeric(),rain=character(),
                                 rate=numeric(),jcode=character())
for(i in unique(dfstate$jcode)){
     df             = subset(dfstate,jcode==i)
     rain           = subset(df,det>0)
     rain           = quantile(rain$det)
     df$rain        = cut(df$det,breaks=c(-Inf,0,rain[2:5]),
                          labels=c("No rain","Q1","Q2","Q3","Q4"))
     df$clocktime   = floor(df$clocktime)
     df$count       = 1
     df$date        = as.Date(df$datetime)
     df             = aggregate(df$count,FUN=sum,by=list(df$night,df$clocktime,df$rain,df$date))
     colnames(df)   = c("night","clocktime","rain","date","value")
     df             = aggregate(df$value,FUN=mean,by=list(df$night,df$clocktime,df$rain))
     colnames(df)   = c("night","clocktime","rain","rate")
     df$jcode       = i
     stoprate_state = rbind(stoprate_state,df)}
stoprate_state$night= ifelse(stoprate_state$night==1,"Night","Day")
#--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
stoprate_city       = data.frame(night=numeric(),clocktime=numeric(),rain=character(),
                                 rate=numeric(),jcode=character())
for(i in unique(dfcity$jcode)){
     df             = subset(dfcity,jcode==i)
     rain           = subset(df,det>0)
     rain           = quantile(rain$det)
     df$rain        = cut(df$det,breaks=c(-Inf,0,rain[2:5]),
                          labels=c("No rain","Q1","Q2","Q3","Q4"))
     df$clocktime   = floor(df$clocktime)
     df$count       = 1
     df$date        = as.Date(df$datetime)
     df             = aggregate(df$count,FUN=sum,by=list(df$night,df$clocktime,df$rain,df$date))
     colnames(df)   = c("night","clocktime","rain","date","value")
     df             = aggregate(df$value,FUN=mean,by=list(df$night,df$clocktime,df$rain))
     colnames(df)   = c("night","clocktime","rain","rate")
     df$jcode       = i
     stoprate_city  = rbind(stoprate_city,df)}
stoprate_city$night = ifelse(stoprate_city$night==1,"Night","Day")
#--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
blackrate_state     = data.frame(night=numeric(),rain=character(),rate=numeric(),jcode=character(),
                                 temperature=character())
for(i in unique(dfstate$jcode)){
     df             = subset(dfstate,jcode==i)
     rain           = subset(df,det>0)
     rain           = quantile(rain$det)
     df$rain        = cut(df$det,breaks=c(-Inf,0,rain[2:5]),
                          labels=c("No rain","Q1","Q2","Q3","Q4"))
     temperature    = quantile(df$tempk)
     df$temperature = cut(df$tempk,breaks=c(0,temperature[2:5]),
                          labels=c("Q1","Q2","Q3","Q4"))
     df$date        = as.Date(df$datetime)
     df             = aggregate(df$black,FUN=mean,by=list(df$night,df$rain,df$temperature))
     colnames(df)   = c("night","rain","temperature","rate")
     df$jcode       = i
     blackrate_state= rbind(blackrate_state,df)}
blackrate_state$night= ifelse(blackrate_state$night==1,"Night","Day")
#--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
blackrate_city      = data.frame(night=numeric(),rain=character(),rate=numeric(),jcode=character(),
                                 temperature=character())
for(i in unique(dfcity$jcode)){
     df             = subset(dfcity,jcode==i)
     rain           = subset(df,det>0)
     rain           = quantile(rain$det)
     df$rain        = cut(df$det,breaks=c(-Inf,0,rain[2:5]),
                          labels=c("No rain","Q1","Q2","Q3","Q4"))
     temperature    = quantile(df$tempk)
     df$temperature = cut(df$tempk,breaks=c(0,temperature[2:5]),
                          labels=c("Q1","Q2","Q3","Q4"))
     df$date        = as.Date(df$datetime)
     df             = aggregate(df$black,FUN=mean,by=list(df$night,df$rain,df$temperature))
     colnames(df)   = c("night","rain","temperature","rate")
     df$jcode       = i
     blackrate_city= rbind(blackrate_city,df)}
blackrate_city$night= ifelse(blackrate_city$night==1,"Night","Day")
```

### Connecticut
```{r,echo=FALSE,fig.height=4}
df = subset(stoprate_state,jcode=="CT2")
ggplot(df,aes(x=factor(rain),y=rate,fill=factor(clocktime)))+
     geom_bar(stat="identity", position=position_dodge(),color="black")+
     facet_wrap(vars(night),ncol=2)+theme_bw()+ylab("Traffic Stops per Hour")+
     theme(axis.title.x=element_blank(),
           legend.position="bottom")+
      guides(fill=guide_legend("Start Clock Time Hour"))
```

```{r,echo=FALSE,fig.height=4}
     theme(axis.title.x=element_blank(),
           legend.position="bottom")+
      guides(fill=guide_legend("Ambient Temperature Quartile"))
```
